ratings.comment: Super nice and knowledgable, mostly just reads off the notes but is super helpful during office hours

lectures are long winded and inefficient. lack of reading and self study material compared to professors of other sections. says he will record every single lecture but quite a few lecture recordings were missing or missing video or missing audio. the course was still easy tho

While Bret was kind and always encouraged reaching out for help/office hours, he would sometimes assume students knew as much as he did. When asking for help, I felt a little confused based on how much jargon is required to understand current concepts. Be ready to study, review lectures, and spend time familiarizing yourself with the content.

Any professor rating based on Stat240 should be 3 b/c of how standardized the course is. Every professor uses the same set of notes and does the same thing. Personally watched Bret's recordings until halfway through when I swapped to Bi who did lectures better IMO. The class was easy outside of the final. Overall, cram for tests and watch lectures.

TBH I did not try very hard in this class as I just want to add ds major and I took some similar classes before and had enough programming skills. But Bret was a really good professor. He just read his slide but his slide is really good and makes sense. Weekly projects took abt 3~4 hrs and exams can be hard. Not hard to pull an A in this class.

I loved the material in this class as an economics and data science double major. However Bret could of taught it better. He would just read off slides, so I stopped going to lecture and just watched them online. Class was pretty disorganized as well. However, The group project wasnt that bad and I thought It was pretty cool.
I really enjoyed his class, he is super nice and always wants students to understand the material. Homework not hard, exams are manageable if you pay attention to lecture.

Bret seems nice enough, but he shouldn't be teaching this class. A lot of time Bret will just upload his own work and talk through it, not explaining the material at all. The homework is brutal, and it is very easy to fall behind. While approachable, and funny, he lacks the patience to explain the functions and tools we are expected to memorize.

Horrible experience with online summer class. Unorganized, unclear, and leave students in the dust. I don't feel like I learned anything from the professor, I just had to use the textbook and try my best. Grading is way to harsh and feedback takes forever.
If you have another option to take stat240, don't take his class. I learned from StackOverflow, not Bret. He is a really kind person but I can't understand his standard of grading.

He seems nice, but he just can't teach an online class. The grading was unclear. The teaching was just him reading a pdf file. I learned nothing from him and his lectures (shoutout to my TA Auden who is an angel, thank you). Don't take online classes with bret is you know whats good for you.

The final project was so BRUTAL, grading was unclear and HARSH. Homework is confusing and takes a long time, tests take so long and are unclear. Bret seems nice but I barely learned anything this semester
the most disgusting course taken, heavy workload, randomly group students and unfairly grade group projects!

He's kind, wants his students to succeed, and is very passionate in what he teaches. In this class, it was sometimes difficult to follow along in lecture. He would often get off-topic and begin to ramble about unrelated conceptsit was unclear of what he was trying to teach us. However, his office hours and extra study sessions are very helpful.

My first professor at UW, but also probably the best professor I have met! He cares about his lectures and students. Extremely nice and approachable! He made me in love with statistics, amazing(I never thought I would!)

Seeing as this class was taught for the first time, I'd say Professor Larget did a pretty good job. Having taken AP Stats, I was able to keep up with lecture material pretty well. If Prof Larget has review sessions available, I would suggest going to them- probably the reason I ended up clutching an AB in the class. He is very friendly and helpful.

Took a first-time course, and Professor Larget seemed to create applicable lectures as we went along, with current events data. It was difficult because of content that was new to me, but he tried to help the class as much as he could. His knowledge and passion are clear, but he could explain things more clearly. Also, he half-coughs fairly often.

Good professor. Exams were not too difficult but they were comprehensive.  The textbook is very useful and essentially required so buy it.  Final had one or two "tricky" or poorly worded questions.  I would take another class with him.

Very good at explaining the concepts and seems genuinely interested in teaching and wanting students to learn the material, which is really basic for an "accelerated" course. My only complaint is that he administers quizzes every day, so you can't miss class even though reading the book is more than sufficient. Homework was tedious and simplistic.

Attendance is required as there is a 5 point quiz on the reading every class. These are always easy so they are grade boosters. The homework included a lot of code which was near to impossible and the TA was an extremely harsh grader. He recognizes if a test is too hard and curves generously. Lectures are extremely dry but he brings food a lot.

Well planned, easy to understand lectures and relevant assignments.  Lecture slides were often not posted until just a few hours prior to the lecture (frustrating to students...hard to print prior to lecture).  Exams were fair and tested required knowledge well.
Good professor, exams were mostly fair and if they weren't he offered retests. Grading scale is very fair, homework is somewhat irrelevant to exam questions. Overall very good.

He doesn't explain anything, and basically assumes we are all geniuses. His tests are ridiculous. Straight A students will struggle to get B's.  If you can take the equivalent classes rather than this one (like Math 431 or another stats class) I would highly recommend skipping over Larget.
Great professor! I would highly recommend him. He is really interested in helping everyone learn and the homework and tests aren't too difficult.
very very kind professor, extremely helpful

I was very excited about stats prior to taking Stat 572.  Dr. Larget was not a very good professor.  He was very distracted by any errors on his notes and this distracted us from his content.  He took a long time to get tests graded and it was difficult to get feedback on what we did wrong.  He needs to change his teaching style!
Good guy, really wants you to succeed.  Practice his previous exams.
An inspiring teacher, makes stats relevant to biology.

Ok class, you have to take it for Horticulture, but please Bret->quit the coughing/aheming/clearing your throat.  It is really annoying!!!  (If you have read Harry Potter 5, think of Delores Umbridge come to life!)
